text: Robert Norton Noyce (December 12, 1927 – June 3, 1990) was an American physicist and businessman. He co-founded Fairchild Semiconductor in 1957 and Intel Corporation in 1968. He was an important person in Silicon Valley.While Kilby's invention was six months earlier, neither man rejected the title of co-inventor.Lécuyer, p. 129 Noyce died of a heart attack at age 62 on June 3, 1990 at a hospital in Austin, Texas. ==Notes== ==References== Category:1927 births Category:1990 deaths Category:American physicists Category:Scientists from Iowa Category:Businesspeople from Iowa Category:Scientists from San Francisco Category:Businesspeople from San Francisco Category:Businesspeople from Austin, Texas Category:Scientists from Austin, Texas Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Intel
title: Robert Noyce
